segment.source: About MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: About MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: About MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: About MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: This topic describes the changes in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1).
segment.target: This topic describes the changes in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1).

segment.source: For a general description of MBAM, see Getting Started with MBAM 2.0.
segment.target: For a general description of MBAM, see Getting Started with MBAM 2.0.

segment.source: What’s new in MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: What’s new in MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: This version of MBAM provides the following new features and functionality.
segment.target: This version of MBAM provides the following new features and functionality.

segment.source: Support for Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager
segment.target: Support for Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1) adds support for Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1) adds support for Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP2
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP2

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1) adds support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP2.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1) adds support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP2.

segment.source: You must use Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 or higher if you are running Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 R2.
segment.target: You must use Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 or higher if you are running Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 R2.

segment.source: Customer feedback rollup
segment.target: Customer feedback rollup

segment.source: MBAM 2.0 SP1 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues that were found since the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 release.
segment.target: MBAM 2.0 SP1 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues that were found since the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 release.

segment.source: As part of these changes, the Computer Name field now appears in the BitLocker Computer Compliance and BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details reports when you run MBAM with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: As part of these changes, the Computer Name field now appears in the BitLocker Computer Compliance and BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details reports when you run MBAM with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: Firewall exception must be set on ports for the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: Firewall exception must be set on ports for the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: When you configure the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring website, you must set a firewall exception to enable communication through the specified ports.
segment.target: When you configure the Self-Service Portal and the Administration and Monitoring website, you must set a firewall exception to enable communication through the specified ports.

segment.source: Previously, the MBAM server installation opened the ports automatically in Windows Firewall.
segment.target: Previously, the MBAM server installation opened the ports automatically in Windows Firewall.

segment.source: Location of MBAM reports has changed in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Location of MBAM reports has changed in Configuration Manager

segment.source: MBAM reports for the Configuration Manager integrated topology are now available under subfolders within the MBAM node.
segment.target: MBAM reports for the Configuration Manager integrated topology are now available under subfolders within the MBAM node.

segment.source: The subfolder names represent the language of the reports within the subfolder.
segment.target: The subfolder names represent the language of the reports within the subfolder.

segment.source: Ability to install MBAM on a primary site server when you install MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Ability to install MBAM on a primary site server when you install MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: You can install MBAM on a primary site server or a central administration site server when you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology.
segment.target: You can install MBAM on a primary site server or a central administration site server when you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology.

segment.source: Previously, you were required to install MBAM on a central administration site server.
segment.target: Previously, you were required to install MBAM on a central administration site server.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The server on which you install MBAM must be the top-tier server in your hierarchy.
segment.target: The server on which you install MBAM must be the top-tier server in your hierarchy.

segment.source: The MBAM installation works differently for Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 and Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager as follows:
segment.target: The MBAM installation works differently for Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 and Microsoft System Center 2012 Configuration Manager as follows:

segment.source: Configuration Manager 2007 : If you install MBAM on a primary site server that is part of a larger Configuration Manager hierarchy and has a central site parent server, MBAM resolves the central site parent server and performs all of the installation actions on that parent server.
segment.target: Configuration Manager 2007 : If you install MBAM on a primary site server that is part of a larger Configuration Manager hierarchy and has a central site parent server, MBAM resolves the central site parent server and performs all of the installation actions on that parent server.

segment.source: The installation actions include checking prerequisites and installing the Configuration Manager objects and reports.
segment.target: The installation actions include checking prerequisites and installing the Configuration Manager objects and reports.

segment.source: For example, if you install MBAM on a primary site server that is a child of a central site parent server, MBAM installs all of the Configuration Manager objects and reports on the parent server.
segment.target: For example, if you install MBAM on a primary site server that is a child of a central site parent server, MBAM installs all of the Configuration Manager objects and reports on the parent server.

segment.source: If you install MBAM on the parent server, MBAM performs all of the installation actions on that parent server.
segment.target: If you install MBAM on the parent server, MBAM performs all of the installation actions on that parent server.

segment.source: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager : If you install MBAM on a primary site server or on a central administration server, MBAM performs all of the installation actions on that site server.
segment.target: System Center 2012 Configuration Manager : If you install MBAM on a primary site server or on a central administration server, MBAM performs all of the installation actions on that site server.

segment.source: Configuration Manager Console must be installed on the computer on which you install the MBAM Server
segment.target: Configuration Manager Console must be installed on the computer on which you install the MBAM Server

segment.source: When you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology, you must install the Configuration Manager Console on the same computer on which MBAM will be installed.
segment.target: When you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager integrated topology, you must install the Configuration Manager Console on the same computer on which MBAM will be installed.

segment.source: If you use the recommended architecture, which is described in Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you would install MBAM on the Configuration Manager Primary Site Server.
segment.target: If you use the recommended architecture, which is described in Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you would install MBAM on the Configuration Manager Primary Site Server.

segment.source: New setup command-line parameters for the Configuration Manager integrated topology
segment.target: New setup command-line parameters for the Configuration Manager integrated topology

segment.source: Command-Line Parameter
segment.target: Command-Line Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME
segment.target: CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME

segment.source: Enables you to install the Configuration Manager reports on a remote SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) server that is part of the same Configuration Manager site to which MBAM is installed.
segment.target: Enables you to install the Configuration Manager reports on a remote SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) server that is part of the same Configuration Manager site to which MBAM is installed.

segment.source: You can set the value to the fully qualified domain name of the remote SSRS point role server.
segment.target: You can set the value to the fully qualified domain name of the remote SSRS point role server.

segment.source: MbamSetup.exe CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME=ssrsServer.Contoso.com
segment.target: MbamSetup.exe CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME=ssrsServer.Contoso.com

segment.source: CM_REPORTS_ONLY
segment.target: CM_REPORTS_ONLY

segment.source: Enables you to install only the Configuration Manager reports, without other Configuration Manager objects, such as the baseline, collection, and configuration items.
segment.target: Enables you to install only the Configuration Manager reports, without other Configuration Manager objects, such as the baseline, collection, and configuration items.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must combine this parameter with the CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID parameter.
segment.target: You must combine this parameter with the CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID parameter.

segment.source: Valid parameter values:
segment.target: Valid parameter values:

segment.source: True
segment.target: True

segment.source: False
segment.target: False

segment.source: You can combine this parameter with the CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME parameter if you want to install the reports only to a remote SSRS point role server.
segment.target: You can combine this parameter with the CM_SSRS_REMOTE_SERVER_NAME parameter if you want to install the reports only to a remote SSRS point role server.

segment.source: If you do not set the parameter or if you set it to False, MBAM Setup installs all of the Configuration Manager objects, including the reports.
segment.target: If you do not set the parameter or if you set it to False, MBAM Setup installs all of the Configuration Manager objects, including the reports.

segment.source: MbamSetup.exe CM_REPORTS_ONLY=True
segment.target: MbamSetup.exe CM_REPORTS_ONLY=True

segment.source: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID=SMS00001
segment.target: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID=SMS00001

segment.source: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID
segment.target: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID

segment.source: An existing collection ID that identifies the collection for which reporting compliance data will be displayed.
segment.target: An existing collection ID that identifies the collection for which reporting compliance data will be displayed.

segment.source: You can specify any collection ID.
segment.target: You can specify any collection ID.

segment.source: You are not required to use the “MBAM Supported Computers” collection ID.
segment.target: You are not required to use the “MBAM Supported Computers” collection ID.

segment.source: MbamSetup.exe CM_REPORTS_ONLY=True
segment.target: MbamSetup.exe CM_REPORTS_ONLY=True

segment.source: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID=SMS00001
segment.target: CM_REPORTS_COLLECTION_ID=SMS00001

segment.source: Ability to turn Self-Service Portal notice text on or off
segment.target: Ability to turn Self-Service Portal notice text on or off

segment.source: MBAM 2.0 SP1 enables you to turn off the notice text on the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: MBAM 2.0 SP1 enables you to turn off the notice text on the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Previously, the notice text displayed by default, and you could not turn it off.
segment.target: Previously, the notice text displayed by default, and you could not turn it off.

segment.source: To turn off the notice text
segment.target: To turn off the notice text

segment.source: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open Internet Information Services (IIS) and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.
segment.target: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open Internet Information Services (IIS) and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.

segment.source: From the Name column, select DisplayNotice, and set the value to false.
segment.target: From the Name column, select DisplayNotice, and set the value to false.

segment.source: Ability to localize the HelpdeskText statement that points users to more Self-Service Portal information
segment.target: Ability to localize the HelpdeskText statement that points users to more Self-Service Portal information

segment.source: You can configure a localized version of the Self-Service Portal “HelpdeskText” statement, which tells end users how to get additional help when they are using the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: You can configure a localized version of the Self-Service Portal “HelpdeskText” statement, which tells end users how to get additional help when they are using the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: If you configure localized text for the statement, as described in the following instructions, MBAM will display the localized version.
segment.target: If you configure localized text for the statement, as described in the following instructions, MBAM will display the localized version.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find the localized version, it displays the value that is in the HelpdeskText parameter.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find the localized version, it displays the value that is in the HelpdeskText parameter.

segment.source: To display a localized version of the HelpdeskText statement
segment.target: To display a localized version of the HelpdeskText statement

segment.source: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open IIS and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.
segment.target: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open IIS and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.

segment.source: In the Actions pane, click Add to open the Add Application Setting dialog box.
segment.target: In the Actions pane, click Add to open the Add Application Setting dialog box.

segment.source: In the Name field, type HelpdeskTextlanguage, where language is the appropriate language code for the text.
segment.target: In the Name field, type HelpdeskTextlanguage, where language is the appropriate language code for the text.

segment.source: For example, to create a localized HelpdeskText statement in Spanish, you would name the parameter HelpdeskTextes-es.
segment.target: For example, to create a localized HelpdeskText statement in Spanish, you would name the parameter HelpdeskTextes-es.

segment.source: For a list of the valid language codes that you can use, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference.
segment.target: For a list of the valid language codes that you can use, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference.

segment.source: In the Value field, type the localized text that you want to display to end users.
segment.target: In the Value field, type the localized text that you want to display to end users.

segment.source: Ability to localize the Self-Service Portal HelpdeskURL
segment.target: Ability to localize the Self-Service Portal HelpdeskURL

segment.source: You can configure a localized version of the Self-Service Portal HelpdeskURL to display to end users by default.
segment.target: You can configure a localized version of the Self-Service Portal HelpdeskURL to display to end users by default.

segment.source: If you create a localized version, as described in the following instructions, MBAM finds and displays the localized version.
segment.target: If you create a localized version, as described in the following instructions, MBAM finds and displays the localized version.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find a localized version, it displays the URL that is configured for the HelpDeskURL parameter.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find a localized version, it displays the URL that is configured for the HelpDeskURL parameter.

segment.source: To display a localized HelpdeskURL
segment.target: To display a localized HelpdeskURL

segment.source: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open IIS and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.
segment.target: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, open IIS and browse to Sites Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring SelfService Application Settings.

segment.source: In the Actions pane, click Add to open the Add Application Setting dialog box.
segment.target: In the Actions pane, click Add to open the Add Application Setting dialog box.

segment.source: In the Name field, type HelpdeskURLlanguage, where language is the appropriate language code for the URL.
segment.target: In the Name field, type HelpdeskURLlanguage, where language is the appropriate language code for the URL.

segment.source: For example, to create a localized HelpdeskURL in Spanish, you would name the parameter HelpdeskURLes-es.
segment.target: For example, to create a localized HelpdeskURL in Spanish, you would name the parameter HelpdeskURLes-es.

segment.source: For a list of the valid language codes you can use, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference.
segment.target: For a list of the valid language codes you can use, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference.

segment.source: In the Value field, type the localized HelpdeskURL that you want to display to end users.
segment.target: In the Value field, type the localized HelpdeskURL that you want to display to end users.

segment.source: Ability to localize the Self-Service Portal notice text
segment.target: Ability to localize the Self-Service Portal notice text

segment.source: You can configure localized notice text to display to end users by default in the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: You can configure localized notice text to display to end users by default in the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: The notice.txt file, which displays the notice text, is located in the following root directory:
segment.target: The notice.txt file, which displays the notice text, is located in the following root directory:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: To display localized notice text, you create a localized notice.txt file and save it under a specific language folder in the following directory:
segment.target: To display localized notice text, you create a localized notice.txt file and save it under a specific language folder in the following directory:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: MBAM displays the notice text, based on the following rules:
segment.target: MBAM displays the notice text, based on the following rules:

segment.source: If you create a localized notice.txt file in the appropriate language folder, MBAM displays the localized notice text.
segment.target: If you create a localized notice.txt file in the appropriate language folder, MBAM displays the localized notice text.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find a localized version of the notice.txt file, it displays the text in the default notice.txt file.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find a localized version of the notice.txt file, it displays the text in the default notice.txt file.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find a default notice.txt file, it displays the default text in the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find a default notice.txt file, it displays the default text in the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If an end user’s browser is set to a language that does not have a corresponding language subfolder or notice.txt, the text that is in the notice.txt file in the following root directory is displayed:
segment.target: If an end user’s browser is set to a language that does not have a corresponding language subfolder or notice.txt, the text that is in the notice.txt file in the following root directory is displayed:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: To create a localized notice.txt file
segment.target: To create a localized notice.txt file

segment.source: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, create a language folder in the following directory, where language represents the name of the localized language:
segment.target: On the server where you installed the Self-Service Portal, create a language folder in the following directory, where language represents the name of the localized language:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Some language folders already exist, so you may not have to create one.
segment.target: Some language folders already exist, so you may not have to create one.

segment.source: If you do need to create a language folder, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference for a list of the valid names that you can use for the language folder.
segment.target: If you do need to create a language folder, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference for a list of the valid names that you can use for the language folder.

segment.source: Create a notice.txt file that contains the localized notice text.
segment.target: Create a notice.txt file that contains the localized notice text.

segment.source: Save the notice.txt file in the language folder.
segment.target: Save the notice.txt file in the language folder.

segment.source: For example, to create a localized notice.txt file in Spanish, you would save the localized notice.txt file in the following folder:
segment.target: For example, to create a localized notice.txt file in Spanish, you would save the localized notice.txt file in the following folder:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Websitees-es
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Websitees-es

segment.source: Upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: Upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: You can upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 from any previous version of MBAM.
segment.target: You can upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 from any previous version of MBAM.

segment.source: Upgrading the MBAM infrastructure
segment.target: Upgrading the MBAM infrastructure

segment.source: You can upgrade the MBAM Server infrastructure to MBAM 2.0 SP1 as follows:
segment.target: You can upgrade the MBAM Server infrastructure to MBAM 2.0 SP1 as follows:

segment.source: Manual in-place server replacement: You must manually uninstall the existing MBAM Server infrastructure, and then install the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server infrastructure.
segment.target: Manual in-place server replacement: You must manually uninstall the existing MBAM Server infrastructure, and then install the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server infrastructure.

segment.source: You do not have to remove the databases to do the upgrade.
segment.target: You do not have to remove the databases to do the upgrade.

segment.source: Instead, you select the existing databases, which the previous version of MBAM created.
segment.target: Instead, you select the existing databases, which the previous version of MBAM created.

segment.source: The MBAM 2.0 SP1 upgrade installation then migrates the existing databases to MBAM 2.0 SP1.
segment.target: The MBAM 2.0 SP1 upgrade installation then migrates the existing databases to MBAM 2.0 SP1.

segment.source: Distributed client upgrade: If you are using the Stand-alone MBAM topology, you can upgrade the MBAM Clients gradually after you install the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server infrastructure.
segment.target: Distributed client upgrade: If you are using the Stand-alone MBAM topology, you can upgrade the MBAM Clients gradually after you install the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server infrastructure.

segment.source: After you upgrade the MBAM Server infrastructure, MBAM 1.0 or 2.0 Clients will report to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server successfully and will store the recovery data, but compliance will be based on the policies available for the MBAM Client version that is currently installed.
segment.target: After you upgrade the MBAM Server infrastructure, MBAM 1.0 or 2.0 Clients will report to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Server successfully and will store the recovery data, but compliance will be based on the policies available for the MBAM Client version that is currently installed.

segment.source: To enable reporting against MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies, you must upgrade client computers to MBAM 2.0 SP1.
segment.target: To enable reporting against MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies, you must upgrade client computers to MBAM 2.0 SP1.

segment.source: You can upgrade the client computers to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client without uninstalling the previous Client, and the Client will start to apply and report, based on the MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies.
segment.target: You can upgrade the client computers to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client without uninstalling the previous Client, and the Client will start to apply and report, based on the MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies.

segment.source: For more information about upgrading the MBAM servers, see Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM.
segment.target: For more information about upgrading the MBAM servers, see Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM.

segment.source: Upgrading the MBAM Client to MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: Upgrading the MBAM Client to MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: To upgrade end-user computers to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client, run MbamClientSetup.exe on each client computer.
segment.target: To upgrade end-user computers to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client, run MbamClientSetup.exe on each client computer.

segment.source: The installer automatically updates the Client to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client.
segment.target: The installer automatically updates the Client to the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client.

segment.source: After the installation, client computers do not have to be rebooted, and the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client starts to apply and report against MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies.
segment.target: After the installation, client computers do not have to be rebooted, and the MBAM 2.0 SP1 Client starts to apply and report against MBAM 2.0 SP1 policies.

segment.source: If you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must upgrade the MBAM client computers to MBAM 2.0 SP1.
segment.target: If you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must upgrade the MBAM client computers to MBAM 2.0 SP1.

segment.source: For more information about upgrading the MBAM client computers, see Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM.
segment.target: For more information about upgrading the MBAM client computers, see Upgrading from Previous Versions of MBAM.

segment.source: Installing or upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1 with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Installing or upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1 with Configuration Manager

segment.source: This section describes the requirements when you are installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 as a new installation or as an upgrade to a previous MBAM 2.0 SP1 installation.
segment.target: This section describes the requirements when you are installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 as a new installation or as an upgrade to a previous MBAM 2.0 SP1 installation.

segment.source: Required files for installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 if you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Required files for installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 if you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: If you are installing MBAM for the first time and you are using MBAM 2.0 SP1 with System Center Configuration Manager, you must create or edit mof files to enable MBAM to work correctly with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: If you are installing MBAM for the first time and you are using MBAM 2.0 SP1 with System Center Configuration Manager, you must create or edit mof files to enable MBAM to work correctly with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: configuration.mof file
segment.target: configuration.mof file

segment.source: If you are using Configuration Manager 2007, you must edit the configuration.mof file by completing step 3 from the item Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007, which follows this item.
segment.target: If you are using Configuration Manager 2007, you must edit the configuration.mof file by completing step 3 from the item Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007, which follows this item.

segment.source: If you are using System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, edit the configuration.mof file by following the instructions in Edit the Configuration.mof File.
segment.target: If you are using System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, edit the configuration.mof file by following the instructions in Edit the Configuration.mof File.

segment.source: smsdef.mof file – follow the instructions in Create or Edit the Smsdef.mof File.
segment.target: smsdef.mof file – follow the instructions in Create or Edit the Smsdef.mof File.

segment.source: Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007
segment.target: Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007

segment.source: If you are upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007, you must update the configuration.mof file to ensure that MBAM 2.0 SP1 works correctly.
segment.target: If you are upgrading to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007, you must update the configuration.mof file to ensure that MBAM 2.0 SP1 works correctly.

segment.source: To update the configuration.mof file:
segment.target: To update the configuration.mof file:

segment.source: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:
segment.target: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:

segment.source: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv
segment.target: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv

segment.source: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Microsoft Configuration Manager.
segment.target: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Microsoft Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Review the block of code that you appended to the configuration.mof file, and delete it.
segment.target: Review the block of code that you appended to the configuration.mof file, and delete it.

segment.source: The block of code will be similar to the one shown in the following step.
segment.target: The block of code will be similar to the one shown in the following step.

segment.source: Copy the following block of code, and then append it to the configuration.mof file to add the following required MBAM classes to the file:
segment.target: Copy the following block of code, and then append it to the configuration.mof file to add the following required MBAM classes to the file:

segment.source: Translation of MBAM 2.0 SP1
segment.target: Translation of MBAM 2.0 SP1

segment.source: MBAM 2.0 SP1 is now available in the following languages:
segment.target: MBAM 2.0 SP1 is now available in the following languages:

segment.source: English (United States) en-US
segment.target: English (United States) en-US

segment.source: French (France) fr-FR
segment.target: French (France) fr-FR

segment.source: Italian (Italy) it-IT
segment.target: Italian (Italy) it-IT

segment.source: German (Germany) de-DE
segment.target: German (Germany) de-DE

segment.source: Spanish, International Sort (Spain) es-ES
segment.target: Spanish, International Sort (Spain) es-ES

segment.source: Korean (Korea) ko-KR
segment.target: Korean (Korea) ko-KR

segment.source: Japanese (Japan) ja-JP
segment.target: Japanese (Japan) ja-JP

segment.source: MBAM 2.0 SP1 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: MBAM 2.0 SP1 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
